name: Eat A Burger!
text: An app deployed on Heroku with HTML served by Handlebars, and data from MySQL. Users can create a burger, and add it to a list and then devour it, which will move it to the devoured list.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Heroku, Node, Handlebars, MySQL, JawsDB

name: Budget Tracker
text: An app deployed on Heroku that allows the user to add expenses and deposits to their budget with or without an internet connection.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Mongoose, MongoDB Atlas, Heroku, Robo 3T, Node, IndexedDB, Cache

name: Note App
text: A simple note taking app where the user can create, save, view, and delete notes.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery, Express, Node, Heroku

name: Weather Dashboard
text: A weather dashboard that allows a user to search a city for the current weather, and 5 day weather forecast. The last several cities are saved to a list that can be clicked on for quick revisiting. This list also saves to local storage.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, LocalStorage, Ajax, OpenWeather API

name: Password Generator
text: A simple password generator that allows users to create a random password by selecting from four character types, and password length. There is also a copy password function.

name: Roam Forth
text: A web application that allows a user to select a state, then lists the National Parks available in that state. Once a park is selected, the user can see park info, pictures taken from the park, available activites, links to the park's web page, as well as directions, and a map that display the location of the park.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Ajax, MapQuest API, National Parks Service API, Materialize Framework

name: Forage
text: A web application that allows users to find out their daily calorie requirements based on goals and activity and then search foods that display ingredients and calories. The user can save their favorite items to their own personal database to be displayed any time.
tech: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Node, Express, MySQL, Axios, Ajax, Edamam API
